description: This interdisciplinary course explores the Sámi, an indigenous people living mainly in the
northern parts of Norway, Sweden, Finland, and Russia.  Students first place the Sámi in a
historical-cultural context by examining the Sámi's social and economic systems, religion,
customs, and values.  The major portion of the course examines the Sámi primarily from within: the
Sámi will present themselves through their literature, film, music, and art.  Taught in English.
Offered periodically. Also counts toward linguistic studies concentration. race and ethnic studies
major and concentration, and international relations concentration.
